intro: Gynema viscida, commonly known as the Indian bignay, is a climbing shrub native to tropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and alternate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Gynema viscida is notable for its use in traditional medicine, where different parts of the plant are utilized for their purported health benefits. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and pharmacological studies.
